Package com.example.webshop.bo

Class Order

java.lang.Object
com.example.webshop.bo.Order
Direct Known Subclasses:
OrderDB
public class Order extends Object
Represents an order placed by a user in the webshop.
Since:
2023-10-07
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tim Johansson

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      protected Order(int orderID, int userID, Date date, String status, ArrayList<CartItem> items)
      Initializes a new Order with all the given attributes.
      Parameters:
      orderID - Unique identifier for the order.
      userID - Identifier for the user who placed the order.
      date - Date the order was placed.
      status - Status of the order.
      items - List of CartItem objects in the order.

  • Method Details

    • getAllOrders

      protected static Collection<Order> getAllOrders()
      Retrieves all orders from the database.
      Returns:
      Collection Collection of all orders.

    • getOrderByStatus

      protected static Collection<Order> getOrderByStatus(String status)
      Retrieves orders by their status from the database.
      Parameters:
      status - Status of the orders to fetch.
      Returns:
      Collection Collection of orders with the given status.

    • placeOrder

      protected static boolean placeOrder(Cart cart, User user) throws SQLException
      Places a new order in the database.
      Parameters:
      cart - Cart object containing items to order.
      user - User object who is placing the order.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the order was successfully placed, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      SQLException - In case of SQL errors.

    • getItems

      public ArrayList<CartItem> getItems()
      Retrieves the list of CartItem objects associated with this order.
      Returns:
      ArrayList The original list of CartItems in the order.

    • sendOrder

      protected static boolean sendOrder(int orderID)
      Sends an order based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      orderID - Unique identifier for the order to send.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the order was successfully sent, otherwise false.

    • getOrderByID

      protected static Order getOrderByID(int orderID)
      Retrieves an order by its ID from the database.
      Parameters:
      orderID - Unique identifier for the order to fetch.
      Returns:
      Order Order object with the given ID.
